segment.source: Domain member Maximum machine account password age (Windows 10)
segment.target: Domain member Maximum machine account password age (Windows 10)

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Domain member Maximum machine account password age security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Domain member Maximum machine account password age security policy setting.

segment.source: Domain member: Maximum machine account password age
segment.target: Domain member: Maximum machine account password age

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Domain member: Maximum machine account password age security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Domain member: Maximum machine account password age security policy setting.

segment.source: The Domain member: Maximum machine account password age policy setting determines the maximum allowable age for a machine account password.
segment.target: The Domain member: Maximum machine account password age policy setting determines the maximum allowable age for a machine account password.

segment.source: In Active Directory–based domains, each device has an account and password, just like every user.
segment.target: In Active Directory–based domains, each device has an account and password, just like every user.

segment.source: By default, the domain members automatically change their domain password every 30 days.
segment.target: By default, the domain members automatically change their domain password every 30 days.

segment.source: Increasing this interval significantly, or setting it to 0 so that the device no longer change their passwords, gives a malicious user more time to undertake a brute-force password-guessing attack against one of the machine accounts.
segment.target: Increasing this interval significantly, or setting it to 0 so that the device no longer change their passwords, gives a malicious user more time to undertake a brute-force password-guessing attack against one of the machine accounts.

segment.source: User-defined number of days between 0 and 999
segment.target: User-defined number of days between 0 and 999

segment.source: It is often advisable to set Domain member: Maximum machine account password age to about 30 days.
segment.target: It is often advisable to set Domain member: Maximum machine account password age to about 30 days.

segment.source: Some organizations pre-build devices and then store them for later use or ship them to remote locations.
segment.target: Some organizations pre-build devices and then store them for later use or ship them to remote locations.

segment.source: If the machine's account has expired, it will no longer be able to authenticate with the domain.
segment.target: If the machine's account has expired, it will no longer be able to authenticate with the domain.

segment.source: Devices that cannot authenticate with the domain must be removed from the domain and rejoined to it.
segment.target: Devices that cannot authenticate with the domain must be removed from the domain and rejoined to it.

segment.source: For this reason, some organizations might want to create a special organizational unit (OU) for computers that are prebuilt, and configure the value for this policy setting to a larger number of days.
segment.target: For this reason, some organizations might want to create a special organizational unit (OU) for computers that are prebuilt, and configure the value for this policy setting to a larger number of days.

segment.source: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesSecurity Options
segment.target: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesSecurity Options

segment.source: The following table lists the actual and effective default values for this policy.
segment.target: The following table lists the actual and effective default values for this policy.

segment.source: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.
segment.target: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.

segment.source: This section describes features and tools that are available to help you manage this policy.
segment.target: This section describes features and tools that are available to help you manage this policy.

segment.source: Changes to this policy become effective without a computer restart when they are saved locally or distributed through Group Policy.
segment.target: Changes to this policy become effective without a computer restart when they are saved locally or distributed through Group Policy.

segment.source: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.
segment.target: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.

segment.source: In Active Directory–based domains, each device has an account and password, just as every user does.
segment.target: In Active Directory–based domains, each device has an account and password, just as every user does.

segment.source: By default, the domain members automatically change their domain password every 30 days.
segment.target: By default, the domain members automatically change their domain password every 30 days.

segment.source: If you increase this interval significantly, or set it to 0 so that the computers no longer change their passwords, an attacker has more time to undertake a brute-force attack to guess the password of one or more computer accounts.
segment.target: If you increase this interval significantly, or set it to 0 so that the computers no longer change their passwords, an attacker has more time to undertake a brute-force attack to guess the password of one or more computer accounts.

segment.source: Configure the Domain member: Maximum machine account password age setting to 30 days.
segment.target: Configure the Domain member: Maximum machine account password age setting to 30 days.
